attributes.Title: Ideas That Change the World
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Honors College
201
UMass Amherst
In this seminar, students will examine texts and works of art that have profoundly shaped the world we live in. The course is divided into four units: Models of Inquiry; the Impact of Science and Technology; Social Philosophy and Civic Engagement; and Art in the World. The course is supplemented with several plenary lectures by distinguished honors faculty speakers.
This course is open to Commonwealth Honors College students only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
16389

attributes.Title: Land Form
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Landscape Contracting
107
UMass Amherst
Practice in use of simple surveying instruments such as tapes, compasses, and levels for measurement of land surfaces. Methods of grading and graphic representations of landform (contours and profiles) explored.
Open to Stockbridge students only.   This course is part of the 2nd Year curriculum for the Landscape Contracting program.  1st Year Landscape Contracting students should not be enrolled. Others may seek permission of the instructor to enroll.
Multiple required components--lab and/or discussion section. To register, submit requests for all components simultaneously.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
34400

attributes.Title: Landscape Drafting
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Landscape Contracting
105
UMass Amherst
Drafting techniques necessary in landscape work, including lettering, line work, freehand sketching, scale drawings, plans, elevations, sections, profiles, composition, and rendering. Eight-week course.
Multiple required components--lab and/or discussion section. To register, submit requests for all components simultaneously.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
64415

attributes.Title: Planting Design
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Landscape Contracting
104
UMass Amherst
In preparation for cooperative work training, the programming for such horticultural practices as pruning, planting, winter protection, and pest control in gardens and nurseries. Eight-week course.
Pre Req: ENVIRDES335&LDCONT112
Multiple required components--lab and/or discussion section. To register, submit requests for all components simultaneously.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
64414

attributes.Title: ST-PLANET Student Career Days
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Landscape Contracting
197B
UMass Amherst
Students will prepare for, compete in and report on their participation in the PLANET-SCD event.  Student Career Days, sponsored by the Professional Landcare Network (PLANET), is an annual event for higher education students in landscape career programs nationwide.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
64430

attributes.Title: Small Property Design
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Landscape Contracting
213
UMass Amherst
Using models, students employ the landscape media of land, plants, structures, and water to create landscape space. Real situations with local clients designed. Techniques of interviewing, photographing, site analysis, and design explored.
Pre Req: LANDCONT 104
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.

attributes.Title: Intro to Landscape Design
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Landscape Contracting
112
UMass Amherst
The landscape media of plants, landforms, structures, and water. Graphic techniques, including modeling, drafting, and plan and cross-section drawings initiated. Examination of built landscape designs in the field and on paper.
This course is open to students in LANDCONT majors only.   This course is part of the Landscape Contracting program.  Others may enroll with the permission of the instructor.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
